benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: PUT /1.0/kb/invoiceItems/{invoiceItemId}/customFields - Modify custom fields to invoice item

covered: Valid Request: Multiple scenarios (TC01-TC05, TC22) verify successful updates with various header and body combinations, including edge cases.
Non-Existing Resource: TC07, TC24, and TC25 cover attempts to update non-existent invoice items and proper 404 handling.
Invalid Payload: TC08, TC10, TC11, TC14 cover malformed JSON, empty body, unsupported fields, and security validation.
Missing Required Header: TC09 ensures 400 is returned when X-Killbill-CreatedBy is missing.
Large Payloads: TC12, TC21 test system behavior with large payloads and performance.
Server Error Handling: TC15, TC16, TC19 cover 500, 504, and 503 errors for backend and dependency failures.
Idempotency: TC17 ensures repeated requests with the same payload are handled correctly.
Regression: TC18 checks for previously fixed data loss bug.
Performance: TC20, TC21 test parallel and large single-item updates.
Edge Cases: TC22, TC23 cover minimum values and unexpected URL parameters.
Partial Update: TC11 ensures unsupported/extra fields are rejected.
Concurrency: TC20 (parallel updates) partially covers concurrency/race conditions.
gaps: Partial Update: No explicit scenario tests for partial updates (e.g., updating only a subset of fields in a CustomField object) and ensuring they are rejected if not allowed.
Concurrency Issues: No scenario directly tests for race conditions where two users attempt to update the same invoice item simultaneously and checks for lost updates or data integrity.
Rate Limiting: No scenario tests API behavior under excessive request rates (e.g., 429 Too Many Requests).
Caching Behavior: No scenario checks for caching headers (ETag, Cache-Control) in responses.
Validation: No explicit scenario for invalid data types or out-of-range values in CustomField fields (e.g., string instead of integer, or exceeding allowed value ranges).
recommendations: Add a scenario to test partial updates to a CustomField object and verify the API rejects or handles them according to spec.
Include a scenario where two users attempt to update the same invoice item at the same time to check for concurrency/race condition issues.
Add a scenario to simulate rate limiting and ensure the API returns 429 when appropriate.
Include a scenario to check for the presence and correctness of caching headers in the response.
Add scenarios to test invalid data types and out-of-range values in CustomField fields to ensure robust validation.
